title: Chinese government donates first batch of anti-epidemic materials to Thailand in 2020
description: On March 24th, 2020, the Chinese government donated its first batch of anti-epidemic materials to Thailand in a handover ceremony at the Thai Ministry of Public Health office in Bangkok, Thailand. The equipment included masks, testing kits, protective clothing, and more.   The ceremony was attended by Chargé d'Affaires of the Chinese Embassy to Thailand Yang Xin and Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Health of Thailand Anutin Charnvirakul. The materials arrived on March 23, 2020 at the Suvarnabhumi Airport.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese government donates first batch of anti-epidemic materials to Thailand in 2020

# Description
On March 24th, 2020, the Chinese government donated its first batch of anti-epidemic materials to Thailand in a handover ceremony at the Thai Ministry of Public Health office in Bangkok, Thailand. The equipment included masks, testing kits, protective clothing, and more.   The ceremony was attended by Chargé d'Affaires of the Chinese Embassy to Thailand Yang Xin and Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Health of Thailand Anutin Charnvirakul. The materials arrived on March 23, 2020 at the Suvarnabhumi Airport.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Anti-epidemic materials including masks, testing kits, protective clothing; healthcare sector focus

title: Chinese Embassy and ICBC donated medical masks to Siriaj Public Hospital in Thailand
description: On May 20th, 2020, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) in conjunction with the Chinese Embassy, donated 51,200 medical masks to the Siriaj Public Hospital.  The Chairman of the Board of Directors, Dr. Zhigang Li, with Executive Vice President Mrs. Orapin Sreesangkom handed over the donation.
staff_comments: 1. From May 19th through the 22nd, mask donations were made to the Thai Red Cross (Project ID# 91596) and various hospitals (Project ID#92855, #92856, #92857, #92858). These donations totaled to 120,000 masks. AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy and ICBC donated medical masks to Siriaj Public Hospital in Thailand

# Description
On May 20th, 2020, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) in conjunction with the Chinese Embassy, donated 51,200 medical masks to the Siriaj Public Hospital.  The Chairman of the Board of Directors, Dr. Zhigang Li, with Executive Vice President Mrs. Orapin Sreesangkom handed over the donation.
justification: Project is a donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of medical masks to hospital, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Embassy and ICBC donated medical masks to the Ramathibodi Hospital in Thailand
description: On May 21, 2020, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) along with the Chinese Embassy in Thailand donated medical masks to the Ramathibodi Hospital. The exact number of masks is unknown.  The Chairman of the Board of Directors, Dr. Zhigang Li handed over the donation. On the same day, masks were also donated to the Rajavithi hospital (Project ID#92856).
staff_comments: 1. From May 19th through the 22nd, mask donations were made to the Thai Red Cross (Project ID# 91596) and various hospitals (Project ID#92854, #92856, #92857, #92858). These donations totaled to 120,000 masks. The exact number of masks to Rajavithi and  Ramathibodi Hospitals, as well as Bamrasnaradura Infectious Diseases Institute  and King Chulalongkorn Memorial Hospital is unkown. The aggregate for these hospitals is 8,800.

title: Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste provides Covid supplies to the Timor-Leste Ministry of the Interior and the Department of Immigration in December 2020
description: On December 21, 2020,  Ambassador Xiao Jianguo donated 4 infrared thermal imagers and 10,000 masks to the Timor-Leste Ministry of Interior and Department of Immigration. These materials will be used to help front-line border inspectors cope with the risk of imported epidemics. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony took place for this donation at the Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste. The Deputy Minister of the East Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Director of Immigration, and Ambassador Xiao Jianguo attended the ceremony.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste provides Covid supplies to the Timor-Leste Ministry of the Interior and the Department of Immigration in December 2020

# Description
On December 21, 2020,  Ambassador Xiao Jianguo donated 4 infrared thermal imagers and 10,000 masks to the Timor-Leste Ministry of Interior and Department of Immigration. These materials will be used to help front-line border inspectors cope with the risk of imported epidemics. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony took place for this donation at the Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste. The Deputy Minister of the East Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Director of Immigration, and Ambassador Xiao Jianguo attended the ceremony.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for pandemic response, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Infrared thermal imagers and masks for COVID-19 prevention, healthcare focus

title: China provides Covid supplies the Timor-Leste Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports in October 2020
description: On October 15, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste donated 40,000 masks and 10,000 bottles of hand sanitizer to the Timor-Leste Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports. The materials will be used to help young students in East Timor prevent and control the Covid-19 epidemic. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony took place for this donation at the Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste. Ambassador Xiao Jianguo of China and Sports Minister Ma Ya of Timor-Leste attended the ceremony.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China provides Covid supplies the Timor-Leste Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports in October 2020

# Description
On October 15, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste donated 40,000 masks and 10,000 bottles of hand sanitizer to the Timor-Leste Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports. The materials will be used to help young students in East Timor prevent and control the Covid-19 epidemic. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony took place for this donation at the Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste. Ambassador Xiao Jianguo of China and Sports Minister Ma Ya of Timor-Leste attended the ceremony.
justification: Project is focused on public health support through donation of medical supplies, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of masks and hand sanitizer for Covid-19 prevention, targeted at education sector

title: Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste provides 40,000 face masks to the Timor-Leste Ministry of the Interior in August 2020
description: On August 27, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Timor-Leste donated 40,000 face masks to the Timor-Leste Ministry of the Interior. The monetary value of this donation is unknown. The materials will be distributed to the Border Patrol Unite Police (UPF) and immigration services for efforts against the COVID-19 pandemic.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
